programme.title: Enfusion Reality Season 1, episode 14
programme.desc: Titiana is the first of the four team captains to qualify for the final by beating Catarina from Portugal in their bout. After that, the two self-called friends Berenise and Eva fight a fierce battle in the ring. It takes an extra round to decide Berenise will now face Titiana in the final. Drago keeps it brief in his semi-final against Ric, by knocking the Englishman out early in the second and qualifying for the big final of Enfusion. After that Pajonsuk and Armen take each other on and their fight is much closer. Here it also takes an extra round to decide the winner but in the end its Pajonsuk who stays in the race for forty thousand dollar.

programme.title: Enfusion Live 44
programme.desc: The World Championships of Kickboxing.

programme.title: Enfusion Reality Season 1, episode 12
programme.desc: Ric and Kaas nearly start a fight at the stare down, than Ric needs to throw up… and afterwards they have another fight to see who gets into the quarter final

programme.title: M-1 Challenge #70
programme.desc: M-1 Challenge is an MMA competition organized with a series of events held in many places around the world. The shows feature the best local and international fighters with spectacular Kos and submissions.

programme.title: Titanic's Pilot
programme.desc: We hear very little about the Pilots who navigated Titanic out of her harbors. Craig Sopin introduces us to David Smyth, who took Titanic out of Belfast Harbor.

programme.title: The Captain's Table
programme.desc: First class trans-Atlantic travel is synonymous with fine dining. For the select few, the ultimate dining experience is to be invited to the Captain’s table. Sauder takes us back in time and gives us a seat at Captain Smith’s table.

programme.title: Titanic's Masters at Arms
programme.desc: Titanic had two security officers on board, they were called Master at Arms. Not much is known about their duties but Craig Sopin gives us a rare look into the lives of these two men.

programme.title: The Titanic Band
programme.desc: Legend tells us they played to the end, but what was daily life like on board for the Titanic Band? Bill Sauder gives us rare insight into not only the Titanic Band, but music on board ships in 1912.

programme.title: Selling Second Class
programme.desc: Senan Molony gives us a rare look at a Titanic advertising brochure directed at second-class passengers. What White Star was selling in the cutthroat world of transatlantic competition back in 1912, might surprise you.

programme.title: Titanic's Three Bladed Propeller
programme.desc: Based on a famous 1911 photograph of Olympic in dry dock, it has always been assumed that Titanic had an identical four-bladed center propeller. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside has uncovered a Harland & Wolff document that describes a three-bladed...

programme.title: Titanic's Morse Lamps
programme.desc: Before radio, ships had to communicate with each other visually. During the day they used hand flags and at night it was through morse lamps. Bill Sauder explains Titanic’s Lamps: where they were located and how they were used.

programme.title: Fixing The Wireless
programme.desc: If Jack Phillips had followed the rules, the wireless set would have still been broken the night the Titanic hit the iceberg and the Carpathia may never have received the distress call in time. Instead, Jack took initiative and fixed it himself and...

programme.title: Five Scratches in the Hull
programme.desc: The prevailing theory has always been that Titanic sideswiped the iceberg creating a 300 ft gash along her side. Famed Titanic Explorer, P.H. Nargeolet, discovered five scratches down her side.

programme.title: Was Titanic's Rudder Too Small?
programme.desc: Was the size of Titanic’s rudder the real reason why she couldn’t turn in time to miss the iceberg? Was the rudder just too small for Titanic’s size? Former Naval Ofﬁcer, Parks Stephenson, gives us the answers.

programme.title: Should Titanic Have Turned into the Iceberg?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson takes on the popular controversy that instead of trying to avoid the iceberg, maybe Titanic should have just turned directly into it? Could this have really saved Titanic?

programme.title: Did the Lights Stay On?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson introduces an eyewitness account who says that the lights stayed on in the aft part of Titanic after she broke! Parks also explains how this could have happened.

programme.title: How Large was Titanic?
programme.desc: Why can’t we get the numbers right after all these years? Just how big was Titanic? Bill Sauder finally sets the record straight and answers the question - Was she the largest ship in the world?

programme.title: More Lifeboats Would Have Just Gotten in the Way
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson tells us why adding lifeboats on Titanic might have actually cost more lives than they would have saved!

programme.title: An Experience of A Lifetime Diving Titanic
programme.desc: He was the first school teacher to dive Titanic, not once - but twice. In this very candid account, Titanic channel host Charles Haas tells us how nerves almost kept him from going. In the end, his journey to his beloved Titanic proved to be an exciting...

programme.title: Was Olympic Retired Too Soon?
programme.desc: Olympic was taken out of service in 1935, after nearly a quarter of a century of a very successful career. Was she retired too soon? It certainly seems there was still plenty of life in her. Mark Chirnside looks at the reasons she was scrapped and why...

programme.title: More Life Boats Would Not Have Helped
programme.desc: Have we been wrong all these years in thinking that more lifeboats would have saved lives? Haas makes a compelling case that this may have been just too simple of an answer.

programme.title: The Coal Burning Fire Photo
programme.desc: At the center of the new coal burning fire documentary, is the photograph that seems to show a 60 ft black mark along the side of Titanic’s hull. Famed artist, Ken Marschall, gives us his view of the photograph and the black mark.

programme.title: The Untold Story of the Titanic Deck Chair
programme.desc: The Titanic story goes out in so many different directions and this is one of them! A Titanic deck chair, recovered by the Mackay-Bennett and later auctioned, provides us with a new Titanic Story that you might not have heard before from Craig Sopin!

programme.title: Goodbye Old Man
programme.desc: These incredible words written by the most senior surviving officer of the Titanic, gives us a rare and historic glimpse of the final moments of the senior men that night. It may surprise you to hear just how calm these men really were.

programme.title: The Gimbal Lamp
programme.desc: One of the features that really set Titanic apart from other ships was her interior illumination. Titanic Channel Host, Bill Sauder, introduces us to a simple, versatile lamp that was used throughout the ship.

programme.title: Titanic's Press Photography
programme.desc: White Star was known for its strong marketing efforts and innovative sales tactics. Titanic interior expert Daniel Klistorner, explains why the photographs taken by the press were so important then and still are today.

programme.title: Kicking the Tires
programme.desc: It’s always been debated how much influence Bruce Ismay had on Captain Smith’s operation of the ship on her fateful voyage. Senan Molony gives us a look at a rare photo that may offer some answers.

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: The Turkish Bath
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Golden Trail Series - Chasing Dreams 2023 - Ep 4 Against all odds (Eng)
programme.desc: At mid-season, Sierre-Zinal sees the return of Run2gethers Kenyan athletes. Rémi Bonnet eyes victory in his home race. The womens race sees the return of Nienke Brinkman pressuring trail star Sophia Laukli.

programme.title: Trail Menorca Cami De Cavalls 2025
programme.desc: Welcome to a new edition of the Trail Menorca Camí de Cavalls Conecta Balear. 185 kilometers tracing the edge of a millennia-old island, blessed with unique natural beauty. Enchanted trails, towering cliffs, and dreamlike beaches shape one of the most demanding routes in the Mediterranean.

programme.title: Maxi Race 2023
programme.desc: Le tOur du lac, (la MaXi Race 88 km / 5000 m D+), course reine du week-end, a livré un scénario haletant avec une course indécise jusqu’au bout. Au départ, à 2 h 50 du matin, ils étaient 1752 coureurs dont 158 femmes.

programme.title: Ungrounded Episode 3 - Meredith Edwards
programme.desc: Meredith Edwards is an elite-level mountain ultra runner, with podium finishes at the Ultra-Trail du Mont-Blanc TDS race, the Javelina Jundred 100K and the Flagstaff Skyrace 55K. She is also a member of the U.S. Ski Mountaineering Team. In Episode 3, she reveals how in 2019 she fought an inner struggle with her body that almost resulted in a full blood transfusion-and came back from it to win one of the world’s most challenging Ultra Marathons. (English version with French, German, Italian and Spanish subtitles available)

programme.title: Georgia Taylor-Brown: Heart Of A Lion | Triathlon Racing Short
programme.desc: Follow Georgia Taylor-Browns 2022 Super League Triathlon Championship Series in our latest racing short episode. Can the Brit make it back to back titles following her triumph in 2021?

programme.title: Cavaioni Bologna Hike
programme.desc: Hike eat hike from the city of Bologna, Italy to the Cavaioni park in the wild hills south of the city . Its a wonderful and eventful 15km round trip hike with a 500 meter climb....Une randonnée depuis la ville de Bologne, en Italie, jusquau parc Cavaioni dans les collines sauvages au sud de la ville. Cest une randonnée merveilleuse et mouvementée de 15 km aller-retour avec 500 mètres de dénivelé positif.Escursione dalla città di Bologna, Italia, al parco Cavaioni nelle selvagge colline a sud della città. È una meravigliosa e movimentata escursione di andata e ritorno di 15 km con una salita di 500 metri....

programme.title: Cassandre Beaugrand: La Vie En Rose | Triathlon Racing Short
programme.desc: Follow Cassandre Beaugrands 2022 Super League Triathlon Championship Series in this racing short episode.

programme.title: Marathon Des Sables 2023 #0
programme.desc: Marathon Des Sables 2023 Day 0. On the MARATHON DES SABLES, Saturday is traditionally dedicated to the material and medical controls, an obligatory passage before attempting the ultimate desert adventure for the 1150 participants of the 37th edition. Marathon Des Sables 2023 Jour 0. Sur le MARATHON DES SABLES, le samedi est traditionnellement consacré aux contrôles matériel et médical, un passage obligé avant de tenter l’aventure désertique ultime pour les quelques 1150 participants de la 37e édition.

programme.title: The First Second - Laetitia Roux E
programme.desc: Championne française la plus titrée de tous les temps, Laetitia Roux a une capacité quasi-irréelle à aller au bout de la difficulté, dans un des sports les plus durs qui soient… . Son entraînement, omniprésent, reste une école permanente de vie. Son esprit de compétition naturel s’oriente de plus en plus vers l’équipe et le partage. Avec le ski-alpinisme, elle voit le monde comme elle l’aime : élevé, lumineux, rapide. Elle est dans le plaisir.

programme.title: Road To One Water Race Ep7 - Body & Mind
programme.desc: One Water Race is an endurance race based on Running, Swimming and Orienteering. 7 mixed teams of 7 athletes have to cross the Stockholm-Sweden archipelago from North to South in a non-stop 250 km race with 200 km of running and 50 km of swimming. They have to completely handle their navigation including in the darkness. Road to One Water Race Ep7 shows the physical and mental pressure that racers have to cope with

programme.title: Nadelhorn Via Normal Route - The Best Alpine Experience Eng
programme.desc: Cris and Viv are hiking to the summit of Nadelhorn (4,327 m), which lies in the Mischabel group in Switzerland. We follow their adventure from the village of Saas-Fee to the Mischabel Hut, a mountain hut that lies at an elevation of 3,340 meters and that has beautiful views of Lenzspitze, Dom, Nadelhorn, Weissmies, and many other 4000-meter peaks. And finally after having crossed the Hohbalmgletscher, they go over the North-East ridge to get to the summit of Nadelhorn which offers superb views of the Alps and their summits such as the Weisshorn and the famous Matterhorn.

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show 2025 - Episode 3
programme.desc: This episode starts in Italy with the Dobbiaco Cortina Cross Country Race and then with the FISU World University Winter Games. We then have a quick presentation of some coming soon event such as the Mallorca 312 OK Mobility and the Comtrade Belgrade Marathon. We then head to Saudi Arabia to enjoy the future of world’s tennis at its best. We then move to the United Arab Emirates for the UAE SWAT Challenge which has emerged as one of the most significant tactical sports competitions in the policing and security sector.

programme.title: Road To One Water Race Ep3 - Swimming
programme.desc: One Water Race is an endurance race based on Running, Swimming and Orienteering. 7 mixed teams of 7 athletes have to cross the Stockholm-Sweden archipelago from North to South in a non-stop 250 km race with 200 km of running and 50 km of swimming. They have to completely handle their navigation including in the darkness. Road to One Water Race Ep3 describes what is involved in swimming 50 km during the day and during the night in between Islands..

programme.title: Chapter 10 Traverse - Reflections On A Brutal Yet Beautiful Adventure
programme.desc: GODZone celebrated ten amazing Chapters of the worlds biggest adventure race. The course traversed the South Island of New Zealand, following a course of 710km, going from the rugged West Coast to the East Coast. 9 days of adventure. Admire the incredible competitors, as they take on the toughest GODZone yet. Chapter 10 was a mammoth course and a monster experience. "Brutal but Beautiful". New Zealand is the ultimate outdoor playground and the birthplace of Adventure Racing.

programme.title: Malawi Bike Tour Part 3
programme.desc: Il nostro amico bikepacker e avventuriero Michele è in viaggio di 4 settimane e 1400 km attraverso la savana, le montagne e le foreste del Malawi. Fantastica avventura africana, paesaggi meravigliosi, grandi incontri umani, fauna selvatica. Parte 3 di Liwonde N.P. a Blantyre.Our friend bikepacker and adventurer Michele is on a 4 weeks and 1400 km bike trip through savanna, mountains and forests in Malawi. Fantastic African adventure, gorgeous scenery, great human encounters, wildlife. Part 3 from Liwonde N.P. to Blantyre.

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show 2024 - Episode 10
programme.desc: We start this episode in Romania with the Brașov Running Festival and two certified races for professional athletes: the tRUNsylvania International 10K and the European Road Mile. Then we move to the Netherlands for the challenge family Almere Amsterdam triathlon. Next is Portugal for another triathlon event : the Triton 1 Lisbon triathlon. Then we move to Croatia for the Highlander which brings hikers from all over the world together. We then head to Kitzbühel Austria for the ski challenge vertical up. Then we move to Canada for the Raid International Temiscamingue. Next we go to Barcelona Spain for some equestrian action with the Longine League of Nations series. Finally we fly to Corsica for the prestigious 33rd AIDA Freediving World Championships.

programme.title: Road To One Water Race Ep8 - Pre Race
programme.desc: One Water Race is an endurance race based on Running, Swimming and Orienteering. 7 mixed teams of 7 athletes have to cross the Stockholm-Sweden archipelago from North to South in a non-stop 250 km race with 200 km of running and 50 km of swimming. They have to completely handle their navigation including in the darkness. Road to One Water Race Ep8 shows how everyone is getting ready for the big race

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show 2022 - Episode 12
programme.desc: We start this episode in Portugal for the Golden Trail Series in the island of Madeira. We then stay in Portugal in the city of Portimao for the Triton World Series, a new multisport brand dedicated to endurance competitions related to the disciplines of swim, bike and run.Then we travel to Spain for the eighth edition of the ARTIEM Epic Camí de Cavalls 360º. Next, we experience a pure cycling experience in Croatia, the Istria300 that attracted 1,500 cyclists from 26 countries. Then we see the preview of the upcoming 8th edition of the Oman Desert Marathon will once again test competitors with a demanding but yet rewarding race. We then meet with Sofia Meakin, the 2021 World Cup Champion in rowing who had surgeries on both of her arms. Finally, we go to Turkey for the 6th CMAS World Outdoor Freediving Championship.

programme.title: Nordhavn 51 Awanui Fort Lauderdale International Boat Show
programme.desc: Step aboard the Nordhavn 51 Awanui, a luxury yacht perfect for long-distance cruising. The vessel offers a functional and elegant design, the result of the shipyards attention to customer feedback.

programme.title: Sanlorenzo SP110 - FLIBS 2022
programme.desc: Displayed at the Fort Lauderdale’s Boat Show was the Sanlorenzo SP110. This model belongs to a new series that embodies the concept of lightness and also a new approach to design.

programme.title: Extra X99 Fast On board a luxury yacht
programme.desc: The Boat Show is on board the new Extra X99 Fast, a luxury yacht that will let you experience the thrill of speed on the sea.

programme.title: A flawless configuration
programme.desc: Get on board the motor yacht Rizzardi INfive, a great yacht that is a pleasure to drive. It is sporty, fast, with a flawless classing configuration. 16 meters of excitement!

programme.title: Lagoon 51- Impactful solutions
programme.desc: Lagoon is a shipyard committed to innovating by creating new boats, never seen before. Federico Maselli presents the Lagoon 51, an incredible boat with impactful solutions.

programme.title: Aventura 37 - International Multihull Show 2023.
programme.desc: The Boat Show is in La Grande-Motte, at the International Multihull Show 2023. Get on board with Federico Maselli.

programme.title: Fountaine Pajot MY6 - St. Petersburg Boat Show 2024
programme.desc: Bill Hackett introduces the new luxury catamaran Fountaine Pajot MY6 at the 2024 St. Petersburg Boat Show. This model offers extraordinary performance, along with a huge and comfortable flybridge to spend the day.

programme.title: New requirements
programme.desc: Our Federico Maselli takes you to the southern part of the Venice Lagoon, to discover the ITA 14.99 by Itacatamarans, the shipyard’s first boat in the field of multihulls. This catamaran perfectly combines the style of Made in Italy with art and design, and fully meets the new market needs.

programme.title: Ecoracer 25 - A virtuous triptych
programme.desc: Too often the disposal of sails and hulls does not respect the environment. So how to get totally green boating? Come and discover with The Boat Show the Ecoracer 25, a sailboat designed by Matteo Polli and built in a completely recyclable fiber compound.

programme.title: Swan 108 Prolific harmonious delicacy
programme.desc: We are touring the proclaimed best boat ever made by Nautor, Swan 108, that is packed with innovations and advanced technology, it is truly a wonderful boat.

programme.title: Dehler 38 SQ – Annapolis Boat Show
programme.desc: The Boat Show is in Annapolis to discover the Dehler 38 SQ, a robust boat that makes everybody in the family happy!

programme.title: Italia Yachts 14.98 Bellissima - Recognisable and unique
programme.desc: How to make a boat memorable? Italia Yachts answers this question with its new Italia Yachts 14.98 Bellissima, taking the concept of beauty to its extreme. Jump on board with our Bacci Del Buono and discover this highly performant cruise sailboat by Italia Yachts.

programme.title: Italia Yachts 12.98 - On board Bellissima
programme.desc: The Boat Show is in Cannes to discover an incredible sailboat! Bacci Del Buono is on board the Italia Yachts 12.98, born from a different design principle that involves an artificial intelligence system.

programme.title: Regatta or cruise
programme.desc: An all-Italian sailboat and a unique opportunity. The Boat Show is on board Scuderia 65 and with Antonio Vettese there are the owner, the designer, the builder and the designer of the sails.

programme.title: Beneteau First 44 Performance and Comfort under Sailing
programme.desc: Hop on board the new Beneteau First, a sailboat that has been a much-awaited project.

programme.title: Giorgio Benussi - The interview
programme.desc: Rachele Vitello is inside The Boat Show studios with Giorgio Benussi, Co-Founder of Sail Class 659F. An interview not to be missed.

programme.title: A maxi sailboat
programme.desc: The Boat Show is on board the Swan 98, a sailboat built in Finland by Nautors Swan. It is part of the shipyards maxi series and is an elegant project, signed by Germàn Frers. Entirely in carbon, this is a boat with great autonomy and comfort.

programme.title: Swan 55 – A winning bet
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese is on board the new sailing Yacht Swan 55 seen at Cannes International Boat Show 2022. Discover its performance.

programme.title: Solaris Yachts - The Shipyards
programme.desc: Our Antonio Vettese brings you to Aquileia, for an exclusive visit inside the Solaris shipyard. Historically well-known as a sailboat manufacturer, has recently started building motorboats. Discover it with The Boat Show.

programme.title: The Luna Rossa Prada Pirelli Team
programme.desc: For Patrizio Bertelli this is his 6th adventure at the American’s Cup, a goal that was never reached before. The 36th Americas Cup Match will be held in Auckland, New Zealand and the Luna Rossa Prada Pirelli Team is getting ready for the upcoming first event of the Prada Cup in Cagliari, Italy.

programme.title: 151 Miglia - Best of 2022 (Eng)
programme.desc: The Boat Show takes you to the best moments of the 13th edition of the 151 Miglia, Cetilar Trophy. With Bacci Del Buono aboard one of the largest and fastest boats, the Vismar 80.

programme.title: 69F - Alessandra Angelini
programme.desc: Alessandra Angelini tells us about her experience aboard the 69F.

programme.title: A productive sailing day
programme.desc: Our new contributor is the professional sailor Tommaso Chieffi and he is about to present you the new Neo 430 Roma. This sailing boat, built by Neo Yachts & Composites, can both be a fast cruiser and a cruiser racer. Come on board!

programme.title: Core Strength Pt 1
programme.desc: Mark Verstegen & WNBA Star Ticha Penicheiro show you how to improve your core strength.

programme.title: Marriage Material
programme.desc: Bishop Luther Lance Love Jones and his wife, Beulah Mae have made a business of saving relationships on the brink of disaster. When three couples show up for their latest marriage retreat, the issues destroying their relationships may be more than even they can fix. Four couples turn to an unconventional retreat to save their relationships to see if they really are Marriage Material. In the process they - along with the hosts of the retreat - will discover truths about themselves, their issues and what matters most.

programme.desc: Kelly Lofton is a young, successful dentist who has all the material things a woman could ask for. programme.title: Doctor's Diaries Episode 12
programme.desc: DOCTORS’ DIARIES is a dramatic reality series that delves deep into the lives of the people who save lives in the trauma center and emergency room in a large urban hospital.

programme.title: Eng 5 Residential Fire
programme.desc: Station 5, its the first morning of this 48 hour shift. They are all doing chores working on the yard. They had just finished up when the call came in; it sounds like a structure fire. As they are in route, it comes over the radio that neighbors are calling in, they see smoke. Engine 5 arrives on scene, the 1st In, and they pull a line, Mike is on the nozzle, and we go into the fire with Mike as he enters the garage, and its blazing. After the fire, they all re-hab, get their bottles filled while the Battalion Chief goes over the ops.

programme.title: Eng 9 From Brush to Structure Fires
programme.desc: We meet the crew from Engine 9 with Captain Karey Wedemeyer on the B" shift. The morning starts off with them getting new SCBAs, then, they catch a EMS run. Back at the Station, since its the Captains Birthday, everyone, including the cameraman, have to workout to one of Kareys workout DVDs,. The Captain is quite the animal lover, she actually works for a Pit Bull shelter in Fresno. 4:00AM, a call comes in. Its a structure fire, at this fire the Captain meets up with her husband, a Captain on Engine 3s "B" Shift. Once again, youll see Captain Durney, he may be close to retirement, but that does not stop him from doing all he can, all of the time.

programme.title: Doctor's Diaries Episode 2
programme.desc: DOCTORS’ DIARIES is a dramatic reality series that delves deep into the lives of the people who save lives in the trauma center and emergency room in a large urban hospital.

programme.title: A day with Traveler David Ramirez at Engine 3
programme.desc: Station 3, Engine 3 "A" Shift with Captain Palmer. Travelers are Firefighters without a Station for a home, and they cover all firefighters at all the stations in a Battalion. Today, we are with Firefighter David Ramirez as he works in the kitchen on some chow. A fire alarm goes off, and the firemen arrive on scene to find a leak. They find the main valve and take care of the problem. Next, a call comes in for a structure fire, and the firemen arrive on-scene to find a homeless person operating a BBQ inside a vacant home that is supposed to be secured by this plywood. Engine 3 has to deal with a tremendous amount of homeless in this part of town. Next, another structure fire, its busy day in the high heat of Central California, The building is vacant, but still dangerous.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 7
programme.desc: Tanks and other wheeled beasts grind across every terrain imaginable during training exercises and while deployed in actual combat. Their versatility is undeniable as they hurtle across sand and snow with equal efficiency

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 8
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part exploration of the militarys mobile cities. Aircraft carriers function like massive well-oiled machines that expand the reach of the armed services.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 9
programme.desc: Part two of a two-part episode on aircraft carriers that shows the sailors and pilots performing the seemingly miraculous task of catching a jet moving at 150 mph on a ships deck thats only 300 ft. long.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 10
programme.desc: The most prolific large ship in the fleet, destroyers were originally built to protect larger ships, but their ability to take on anything that comes their way, from air or sea, makes them formidable opponents in their own right.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 11
programme.desc: The second-largest ships in the fleet, after aircraft carriers, cruisers function as mobile missile platforms, always on the lookout for enemy aircraft or incoming missiles.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 12
programme.desc: Stand on the deck and crouch through the holds of the vessels that have inspired countless movies. From the modern computer stations to the apparently timeless engine rooms, real-life submarines have just as many stories to tell.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 13
programme.desc: Exciting footage of submarines ripping through the waves and breaking through thick sheets of ice. Anywhere, in any season, the sailors operating these stealthy ships are always prepared for action.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 14
programme.desc: Whether theyre rolling, sailing, or standing in place, cannons employed by modern military forces are a far cry from the first gunpowder projectiles found in 12th century China.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 15
programme.desc: Rockets can take our space program to the next frontier or deliver an enemy target back to the stone ages. It takes a balance of science and courage to build and deploy these payload delivery systems, as well as their more sophisticated, guidance-controlled siblings, missiles.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 16
programme.desc: Keep your eye on the target alongside soldiers on the training grounds, as they master the weapons used by modern military forces.

programme.title: Michael Bolton - Live at the Royal Albert Hall
programme.desc: Join Michael Bolton for an unforgettable concert at London's famous Royal Albert Hall as he delivers hit after hit in his trademark soulful style in front of a packed audience. With his inimitable voice, charismatic stage presence and superb songwriting Michael Bolton holds the audience in the palm of his hand as he performs classics such as "How Am I Supposed To Live Without You?", "Time, Love And Tenderness", "Can I Touch You There" and "How Can We Be Lovers" alongside his unique interpretations of "Fly Me To The Moon", "Summertime", "That's Life" and "(Sittin' On) The Dock Of The Bay" plus his own rendition of "Murder My Heart", the hit he co-wrote with Lady Gaga. Simply a wonderful night.

programme.title: The Moody Blues - Days of Future Passed Live
programme.desc: Celebrating the 50th anniversary of their landmark album, Days of Future Passed, The Moody Blues took to the road to perform the entire LP live. This film, capturing an electric evening at The Sony Centre, Toronto, where the band was joined on stage by a full orchestra for the first time ever, is the definitive performance of this seminal album. This spectacle of a show features stunning visuals and a unique narration performed by Jeremy Irons, transporting the audience and viewer to the psychedelic dream world of their classic record. Including the iconic hits Nights In White Satin and Tuesday Afternoon, this film truly pays homage to five decades of musical mastery. In this impressive yet intimate auditorium, The Moody Blues have never sounded better.

programme.title: Ellie Goulding - Live at the iTunes Festival
programme.desc: Do not just be fascinated by the beauty and girlishness of this bright-eyed Englishwoman. Ellie Goulding has a lot more to offer fans of good pop music and its electronic variations. Since releasing her first album in 2010, Ellie has traveled the world to showcase her talents, both in the voice and in the composition of her songs. These talents can be seen in this show at the iTunes Festival in London, with special mention for the songs "Burn", "Halcyon", "Lights" and "My Blood".

programme.title: Turtle Paradise 2
programme.desc: Leave your worries from the world above behind and dive into a vibrant undersea world inhabited by the iconic sea turtles, for 2 full hours of Nature Relaxation. Captured by filmmaker collaborators Tilo & Yvonne Kühnast, Turtle Paradise features hundreds of unique real-time video scenes captured from around the Caribbean, paired with gentle underwater sounds & calming music for deep relaxation by Jason Stephenson.

programme.title: A Day in Santorini
programme.desc: Turn any screen into a window the the Greek Islands with this immensely relaxing HD visual journey through the unique and beautiful coastal village of Oia, found on the far tip of Santorini Island. Slowly awaken your senses as the morning sun rises over the sea, and watch as day slowly passes into dusk. Distant waves break and birds chirp adding an a nice ambient music that combines to create a video that's so relaxing it's almost trance-inducing.

programme.title: Lush Vineyards: Portugal
programme.desc: Escape to the jaw-droppingly beautiful Douro Valley, Portugal’s most scenic wine regions.

programme.title: South Australia Seas
programme.desc: "South Australian Seas" transports viewers to the remote and gorgeous southern coasts of Australia as captured from above. For one full hour, you'll be gently transported from one vibrant ocean scene to the next paired with real-life ocean sounds and sublimely beautiful ambient music by Relax Moods.

programme.title: Relaxing Orchid Garden
programme.desc: Wind down with delicate flowers, swaying in the gentle breeze.

programme.title: Philippe Herreweghe, Collegium Vocale Gent, Dorothee Mields & Thomas Hobbs - J. S. Bach - Chamber music
programme.desc: Philippe Herreweghe conducts his Collegium Vocale Gent in this chamber music program dedicated to the music of J. S. Bach. On the program are Bach’s Orchestral Suite No. 4 in D major, BWV 1069; Gott der Herr ist Sonn und Schild, BWV 79; and Missa brevis in G major, BWV 236. The soloists are soprano Dorothee Mields, tenor Thomas Hobbs, countertenor Alex Potter, and bass Peter Kooij. The program continues with a fine selection of Bach’s works performed by French lutenist Thomas Dunford. On the program are Suite for lute in G minor, BWV 995; Suite for solo cello in G major (arr. for lute), BWV 1007; and Chaconne from Partita for solo violin in D minor (arr. lute), BWV 1004. This concert was recorded at Concertgebouw Brugge, Belgium, in 2017.

programme.title: Philippe Herreweghe, Collegium Vocale Gent, Dorothee Mields & Thomas Hobbs - J. S. Bach - Chamber music
programme.desc: Philippe Herreweghe conducts his Collegium Vocale Gent in this chamber music program dedicated to the music of J. S. Bach. On the program are Bach’s Orchestral Suite No. 4 in D major, BWV 1069; Gott der Herr ist Sonn und Schild, BWV 79; and Missa brevis in G major, BWV 236. The soloists are soprano Dorothee Mields, tenor Thomas Hobbs, countertenor Alex Potter, and bass Peter Kooij. The program continues with a fine selection of Bach’s works performed by French lutenist Thomas Dunford. On the program are Suite for lute in G minor, BWV 995; Suite for solo cello in G major (arr. for lute), BWV 1007; and Chaconne from Partita for solo violin in D minor (arr. lute), BWV 1004. This concert was recorded at Concertgebouw Brugge, Belgium, in 2017.

programme.title: David Grimal - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Les Dissonances & David Grimal - Brahms - Symphony No. 2 in D major, Op. 73
programme.desc: Les Dissonances is a collective of artists founded by violinist David Grimal in 2004. The conductorless ensemble consists of musicians from the most prestigious European orchestras, international soloists, and young talents. In this performance, Les Dissonances present Johannes Brahms’s Symphony No. 2 in D major, Op. 73. Whereas it took the composer over a decade to complete his first symphony, he penned his Symphony No. 2 in just a few months, during his summer sojourn in the restful Austrian village of Pörtschach in 1877. Nicknamed his ‘Pastoral’ symphony, the work is arguably the most sunny and optimistic of Brahms’s four symphonies. Lyrical in character, it features joyful melodies. This performance was recorded at Philharmonie de Paris, France, in 2015.

programme.title: Julie Berthollet - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Martha Argerich, Evgeny Kissin, Theodosia Ntokou & Cristina Marton-Argerich - Martha Argerich – A Birthday Celebration - II
programme.desc: On the occasion of her 80th birthday, Argentinian pianist Martha Argerich explored repertoire for piano and violin in this wonderful concert, recorded at Château de Chantilly, France. The ‘Grande Dame’ of the piano is joined by various renowned artists, including pianists Evgeny Kissin, Theodosia Ntokou, and Cristina Marton-Argerich, and violinist Maxim Vengerov. On the program are Dmitri Shostakovich’s Concertino for two pianos, Op. 94; Frédéric Chopin’s Impromptu No. 3, Op. 51, Polonaise No. 6, Op. 53 “Heroic”, and Waltz No. 6, Op. 64 No. 1; Camille Saint-Saëns’s Polonaise for two pianos, Op. 77; César Franck’s Sonata for violin and piano in A major; and Fritz Kreisler’s Liebesleid and Schön Rosmarin. This performance was recorded on June 12, 2021.

programme.title: Sammy Davis Jr - Sammy Davis Jr. - Concertgebouw Amsterdam
programme.desc: The Royal Concertgebouw in Amsterdam is a world-renowned concert hall, known for its first-rate acoustics. It has attracted many famous performers over the years and is one of the Netherlands' most treasured musical institutions. On May 28, 1967, American singer and actor Sammy Davis Jr. appeared at the Concertgebouw in Amsterdam for a live, nationwide TV broadcast. Supported by his band conducted by George Rhodes, Davis Jr. combined his singing talent and infectious sense of humor as he covered songs from a variety of genres.

programme.title: Rahsaan Roland Kirk - DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Gregory Porter, Chip Crawford, Aaron James & Emanuel Harrold - Gregory Porter at the Blue Note Festival
programme.desc: Unlike many of his fellow jazz cats, vocalist Gregory Porter transcends the jazz bubble. After sustaining a shoulder injury, this former American football player turned to jazz singing. He was discovered in a Californian jazz club by pianist, saxophonist and composer Kamau Kenyatta. Porter lent his vocal skills to gospel choirs across the country and a string of successful musicals before turning his talent to his own compositions. His rise since then has been meteoric. Porter’s magnificent, burnished baritone can sink into a lyric with luxurious ease, the melody gently sculpted into new shapes at every turn, with the rhythm tugging subtly back and forth across the bar line. This live performance at the Olympia showcases this man's worth, and is a truly amazing experience!

programme.title: Charles Lloyd - DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: B.B.King - B.B. King Orchestra - The North Sea Jazz
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festival’s staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. Back in 1979, legendary American blues guitarist B.B. King gave an unforgettable performance for the audience in The Hague. Born in 1925 in a small town in Mississippi, 'Lucille' (as he nicknamed his guitar) helped him escape a miserable existence picking cotton. He arrived in Memphis in the late 1940s, where his cousin Bukka White taught him the tricks of the blues. Soon he developed his own style. King’s virtuoso, narrative solos with lots of vibrato, have been an inspiration for most (rock) guitarists after him.

programme.title: Morning Movers
programme.desc: Don’t miss the go-to resource for pre-market action from the floor of the New York Stock Exchange. Join Diane King Hall for breaking economic news, expert analysis, technical insights, and real-time trading strategies.

programme.title: Opening Bell
programme.desc: Opening Bell

programme.title: Morning Trade Live
programme.desc: Sam Vadas takes traders beyond the headlines with a sharp focus on the macro drivers, sector rotations, and global forces shaping the day’s market action. From breaking down U.S. and international economic data to analyzing sector performance and cross-asset moves, Morning Trade Live delivers the context traders need to understand the “why” behind early trading activity.

programme.title: Trading 360
programme.desc: After the dust settles from the opening bell, Trading 360 with Marley Kayden features Wall Street’s best traders, analysts and technicians to break down sectors and stocks moving markets. Trading 360 focuses on disruptive companies and new technologies driving market headlines while providing investors a 360-degree actionable approach to trading.

programme.title: Fast Market
programme.desc: Host Diane King Hall teams up with veteran traders Tom White and Kevin Hincks to break down live market moves and deliver actionable trade ideas in real time. From options strategies and volatility plays to earnings reactions, they bring in market specialists, analysts, and guests to give active traders the setups and strategies they can use right now.

programme.desc: This quiet island is less than a two-hour-drive south of Tallahassee, the states capital. This family-friendly destination features no mega-malls or putt-putt. Beaches and condos are the stars here.

programme.title: European holiday destinations see rise in coronavirus cases
programme.desc: Western Europe may no longer the global epicentre of the Coronavirus. but despite fewer COVID-19 hospitalisations and fatalities in the majority of EU countries, many have seen spikes occur during the holiday season. Several local authorities have been quick to blame tourists. Find out more by watching our report in the player above.

programme.title: Taipei
programme.desc: Being underestimated, is one of the biggest advantages. Maybe that’s what makes Taipei a unique city and one of Asia’s best kept secrets when it comes to food, fun, and all things lifestyle. Often under-reported and overlooked, Taiwan’s global impact for such a small island is breathtaking. When it comes to Taiwan and food, experts and enthusiasts alike know that they go hand-in-hand. It is no wonder Taipei is overflowing with electricity as new ideas and re-imagined classics are popping up all over town. This magical friction is a big reason Taipei’s food scene is attracting young talent from the world’s best kitchens looking to experiment, innovate, and test their ideas against the discerning palates of the local crowds. Highlighted by some of the world’s best produce, great transportation, magnificent hiking trails 5 minutes from downtown, a vibrant nightlife, and an openness towards travelers and new faces makes Taipei one of Black Buddha’s favorite cities.

programme.title: "This is insane" Supercar Blondie's F1 crash course
programme.desc: Euronews Evan Bourke joins social media star, Supercar Blondie , to test drive an F1 racing car in Dubai. Shes become a social media sensation for testing out some of the worlds most beautiful cars, so what better way to meet Supercar Blondie , than to propose a test drive in the ultimate racing machine - an F1 race car. Euronews Dubai based correspondent Evan Bourke was given the breathtakingly gruesome job -honestly, his colleagues are not jealous - of having to take part in the test drive at the Dubai Autodome . The race track is one of the few places in the world where it is possible to get in an F1 car and experience the adrenaline rush that 6G and more than 500 horsepower has to offer. Supercarblondie has six million Instagram followers and is known for her love of Supercars but even this was a first for her. To watch the full episode of Adventures, click on the video link above.

programme.title: Vanessa Huang
programme.desc: Vanessa HuangWe sat down with Vanessa Huang, owner and chef of Ephernite, a French restaurant that’s popular among those in the know. Vanessa’s restaurant celebrates delicious dishes and memorable moments. She talks us through her inspiration behind what is one of Taipei’s most warm and authentic French dining experiences.Interview: Vanessa HuangActually our restaurant is unlike others in Taiwan, in that our menu is different everyday. We make adjustments based on our daily findings at the market, and we design our menu around that. For example, if we see really fresh seafood or vegetables or meat, we’ll put that on the menu.I can’t really say that I have one signature dish, and even when our guests keep coming week after week asking for a specific dish, I get bored of making the same thing and will want to move on to something else. What I like is giving our guests something new every time.A very special moment for me is when my parents go to the fields themselves and handpick ingredients for me, like lemongrass, lily flower root, etc, and I’ll use them to make ice cream or appetizers. And the part that makes me most proud and happy is when I get to tell our customers, ‘this was handpicked by my mom!’. But of course, it doesn’t happen often, only sometimes when the chance arises.I went to France at the end of 2002, to attend the cooking school, Ferrandi. At the time I just wanted to have my own little coffee shop, like most young girls. But one day my chef, my mentor at the school, asked me if I wanted to do a stage (internship) at a 3 starred Michelin restaurant, he thought it was a great opportunity for me. I agreed, not even knowing what Michelin was, and that experience would go on to change my life.Being the only female and foreigner student during my stage, I didn’t want to lose to everyone else, and I would push myself to keep up. Although it was daunting and disheartening when I couldn’t understand my teacher, I continued to give it my all, and at the time I felt like maybe I was working harder than othe

programme.title: Where to Stay in the British Virgin Islands
programme.desc: The British Virgin Islands are home to some of the most luxurious and rustic resorts in the world. Teri explores the Scrub Island Resort on Scrub Island and Little Dix Bay and Birras Creek Resort on Virgin Gorda.

programme.title: Beijing
programme.desc: Being the capital of China is a colossal responsibility. With over a billion people watching, Beijing seems to manage the task with dignified ease. The pace of life in this city speaks volumes about its personality and its characters. The mood is steady, confident, and proud. With walls that never end, ducks that bear golden skin, and Forbidden Cities out in the open, Beijing has a storybook magic that can only be found in a megacity overflowing with such rich history and tradition. The landmarks and landscapes are dominant forces, followed by the new developments mounted by modernization. Knowing where to look will be the key to unlocking the cities best adventures and experiences. Don’t be afraid to explore the many interesting nooks and crannies of Beijing’s streets and alleys, as there are many. From the bucket list worthy monuments, to the waves of new restaurants, shops, and cultural encounters available, be sure not to rush. Beijing is a hotbed of commerce and entrepreneurship, and inspires the country’s top artists, students, writers, film-makers, musicians, and creatives to converge within its frontiers. With so much to explore in one of the oldest cities on the planet, traveling somewhere else seems irresponsible - there’s no place like ‘the capital.’

programme.title: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Theres the LA you see in the movies, and then theres the real LA—a gritty, fantastically diverse collection of neighborhoods sprawled between ocean and mountains, each with its own distinct mood. Los Angeles spent years striving to emulate towns like New York or San Francisco, but over the last decade the city took a long hard look in the mirror, dug what it saw, and started focusing on what it does best: casual, multicultural, and effortlessly cool.The new LA is the place everyone suddenly wants to be, where high and low converge on palm-lined sidewalks. The countrys most thriving food scene is here, run by a guerilla band of ethnically diverse chefs cooking up whatever they want, wherever they want, with the best produce in the world. From the industrial warehouses east of downtown to the beachside shopping meccas of Venice, LAs cutting edge street style, art scene, and culinary chops cant be contained—the creative energy pops through the concrete like ficus roots. And just to sweeten the deal, 280-plus days of breezy sunshine form the backdrop of it all. Just dont forget your shades.

programme.title: Keeping It Fresh In NYC
programme.desc: For the best mens clothing stores in NYC, Travel Savvy asked Jamal Momon, founder & designer of the Dirty Razkal fashion label, about stylish NYC menswear spots.

programme.title: Panoramic Paramotoring
programme.desc: It consists of a tricycle, an engine powering a propeller that fills a canopy and - thankfully- a back-up canopy. One of the smallest aircraft in the world, Paramotors are the latest way to take to the skies above Dubais sand dunes. And as its wing rises, so does Euronews James OHagans nerves: "My pilot Jos assures me he’s never needed it ( the backup wing)." The morning mist clears and Jos Vandenbroucke, General manager pf Paramotor Desert Adventure, has given the word to go ahead. "Ready for rock and roll? he says. "We’re like 40/50 metres. No more. We can easily go up to 12,000 feet. In case we have an engine failure, it’s just doing this (Jos turns off engine)." Paramotors are one of the smallest aircraft in the world and have a great safety record because the engine is only needed for gaining altitude and can be switched off when you come back down to land. "We will do a spiral. If you can’t hold it anymore James, you just shout." "Now we do a 360 to the right. Yalla, here we go!" "The G-force in your stomach is class!" says OHagan. Flying over a stretch of desert reserve, you can see an array of wildlife; families of camels, Arabian oryx and even a tower of giraffes. "After that, I think I can safely say that I’ve got over my fear of flying and kiss the ground," says OHagan.

programme.title: Dubai's coolest indoor attractions offer a break from the summer heat
programme.desc: Dubai is known for its year-round sunshine and blue skies but sometimes opting for an indoor attraction can offer a break from the heat. This feature of Life takes you on a tour of the best under-cover attractions the city has to offer. The Green Planet One indoor attraction on offer is The Green Planet - a man-made rainforest that is home to over 3000 species of plants and animals. The unique structure is designed specifically to be the ideal habitat for tropical plants and animals despite being in the middle of the Dubai desert. There are a range of attractions at the Green Planet - most notably the piranha tank where over 1,000 of the fish are on display. Once a day at 16:00 visitors can see a feeding session . Piranhas are notorious for their razor sharp teeth and carnivorous eating habits. Other attractions include the Australian Walkabout - a multi-species exhibit featuring the Australian carpet python, white tree frogs, the lace goanna lizard residing in an abandoned plane and many more. Housing plants and animals from such a contrasting climate to Dubais requires sophisticated technology. Sara Stevens is the curator of The Green Planet: "The glass for the windows was imported from overseas to be 82 UV penetrable to allow for all those nutrients to come in. Even the misting system is digital and automatic to make sure that if the humidity drops below 80 percent in the building it sprays on every level to provide the perfect environment for all the animals." Sara Stevens said the facility is a chance for young people to learn about conservation first-hand: "It’s one thing to of course learn about conservation in the classroom but it’s another to come here, experience a bird flying by you, a sloth next to you and see where the ginger, vanilla or chocolate that you eat comes from and the plants that are there and then learn how important it is to conserve." iFly Dubai If you have always wanted to experience the feeling of skydiving without having to jump out of a plane or off of a cli

programme.title: Tour of quirky Anna Maria Island, Florida
programme.desc: Take a video tour of Anna Maria Island, Florida, where chain restaurants and hotels are nearly impossible to find. Instead this Gulf of Mexico island thrives on a mix of California earthiness and Florida quirkiness.

programme.title: Monkey Island
programme.desc: Needing a break from the bright lights of the big city? An escape to a simpler way of life is just a 90 minute trip from Bangkok to Monkey Island in Samut Songkhram province. For 700bht you can take a boat ride to meet the famous swimming monkeys and see how the local fishing community (Khlong Klone) lives. After feeding those ravenous monkeys some bananas, treat yourself to some amazing local seafood. It may be a perfect end to a low key Sunday after a night of the other kind of monkey business.

programme.title: Best Brooklyn Eats
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmer, editor at Time Out New York, shares his favorite Brooklyn restaurants and international eateries. Find out the best Brooklyn restaurants here.

programme.title: Kristen Taekman's NYC Fashion Finds
programme.desc: Model, mommy, housewife & entrepreneur Kristen Taekman keeps us stylish with her favorite fashion finds in New York City. See her list here!

programme.title: Hong Kong
programme.desc: From the simple perfection of summer boating, to the daily eruption of energy that is Lan Kwai Fong, Hong Kong has you covered an all things food, drink, entertainment, and lifestyle. The enchanting neighborhoods are coiled with history and culture, each with its own timeline of stories that speak persuasively about Hong Kong’s modernization. Situated against the backdrop of its secret cove-like harbor, the architecture that graces the land is just as extreme. Hong Kong sits atop the throne as the city with the most skyscrapers in the world, yet the urbanized areas are only a fraction of the city itself. The nature that surrounds and pushes through the city, gives Hong Kong it’s true indescribable magic. Denizens know where to find the hiking trails, the views, and escape routes to the open sea. The endless culinary delights, bold experiences, and hidden treasures make Hong Kong a torchbearer of culture, innovation, and lifestyle in Asia.

programme.title: A Real Housewife's Key West
programme.desc: Kristen Taekman from The Real Housewives of NY gives her list of things to do in Key West, Florida.

programme.title: Adventures – Explore, dive and discover the sealife in Dubai’s waters
programme.desc: An hour and a half away from the city of Dubai, Euronews James OHagan joined the Dubai-based centre Divers Down to complete his PADI training and have his first proper dive. Michela Colella, Operations Manager, Divers Down UAE said, "We will go to an average depth of 14 metres. We’ll look for trumpet fish, triggerfish, clownfish, pufferfish, boxfish." Even with the basic training completed, diving with an instructor helps you feel safer, develop the right habits, and take in all the best spots on the dive site. Some of the most spectacular coral and marine life are located just 5 metres from the surface. At that depth, everything is lit up beautifully and the air lasts much longer than at 10 or 15 metres. The reef has species ranging from stingrays to lobsters, jawfish, parrotfish, broomtail wrasse, and many others. For more experienced divers there are dozens of shipwrecks and artificial reefs to explore each with unique histories and coral formations. At times it feels as if you’re flying in slow motion in some sort of alien landscape. And before you know it, it’s time to come back to the real world. Euronews James OHagan exclaimed, "Oh! That was incredible! Breathtaking!

programme.title: Marin County: A Girl’s Weekend Destination
programme.desc: From cheese tastings to winery tours, Californias Marin County is full of some some seriously decadent activities for a trip with the girls.

programme.title: Kanda
programme.desc: One way to think about Kanda is to picture early Brooklyn, before the hipsters completely took over. It’s a place that perfectly embodies old and new Tokyo, a university town that attracts more than students. It’s a great place to live (some even think it’s one of the best kept secrets of Tokyo) with just about everything you need in one place — restaurants, nightlife, shopping, and easy access to just about any other part of the city. While tall gleaming skyscrapers haven’t taken over the landscape like much of Tokyo, there’s a good balance of historical and contemporary architecture to keep things interesting.Walk around and you’ll find neighborhood pockets that focusing on one thing: an entire street of used bookstores, another with stores and stores hawking vintage and new guitars; a three-story mecca for old-school arcade games; an entire block for ski and snowboarding gear. You can find Michelin-starred restaurants, gyoza specialists, internationally known ramen shops, and even great burger joints around the corner from each other. With friendly and fiercely proud locals who want to share the area’s history, from origami to the Kanda Myojin Shrine, this is a quieter part of Tokyo just waiting to be discovered.

programme.title: A Tour of Australia's Kangaroo Island
programme.desc: Australias third-largest island, you can see everything on Kangaroo Island, from the beach to the bush to its namesake inhabitants. The islands rock landscape is a playground for adventurers.

programme.title: Going to London with Kids?
programme.desc: Visiting London with your kids? Dont miss out on Londons Top 4 Must-See Attractions.

programme.title: Chiloe: Exploring Chile's Largest Island & Warmest Secret
programme.desc: The snowy peaks of the Andes are visible, but whats this? Lush rolling hills, a radical new resort and biking in (gasp!) shorts? Welcome to Chiloé, the archipelago Chileans covet most. Islands videographer Jon Whittle shares why from the poshest resort in Patagonia, Refugia.

programme.title: Fun Stuff to do in Brooklyn
programme.desc: Have fun like a kid. Andrew Zimmer tells us where to get ice cream, play video games, go bowling, and more things to do in Brooklyn.

programme.title: Balloon trip gives passengers a real bird’s eye view of the desert
programme.desc: Ballooning is the earliest form of human flight. In 18th century France, King Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette watched as the first passengers - a duck, a rooster and a sheep - took off in one from Versailles . These days it’s a big attraction for tourists the world over. But in Dubai, hot air ballooning comes with a twist. You can fly with a peregrine falcon. Falconer Dylan Freeman says its the only place in the world where you can fly with the fastest animal on the planet. “What were trying to simulate here is having the falcon soaring. “Theyve been recorded reaching speeds of 389 km/h in a dive. From one kilometre up he can see a pigeon four kilometres away. So then he would fly above it, fold up his wings, and dive down really quickly to try and catch it.” Peter Kollar, co-founder and chief pilot of Balloon Adventures Dubai , says dawn is a good time to take to the skies. “Its a beautiful area because its a mix of desert, pristine desert …… and there are green oases in the desert, which gives a beautiful contrast.” Kollar says the route the balloon takes is very much up to the weather. “Eighty per cent of my work is meteorology. If we get the weather right my job is relatively simple. Really ballooning is true flying because you have to use Mother Nature.”

programme.title: Durban Nature Trails
programme.desc: Durban, South Africa: Durbans natural spaces and canopy of trees provide vital space for nature

programme.title: Markets, Art, Food, & More in NYC

programme.title: Why visitors are hooked on Dubai Marina, home to luxury yachts, docks, hotels and beach clubs
programme.desc: Whether you see it from the deck of a boat or the wire of its 1km zipline, Dubai Marina is a spectacle of ground-breaking architecture, bespoke superyachts and luxury shoreline hospitality. This sought-after holiday destination encompasses the coastal neighbourhood of Jumeirah Beach Residence, known locally as JBR, home to retail and entertainment developments The Walk and The Beach, which multiple the attractions for fun-seekers. Iconic five-star hotels hug the shoreline, their vast marble lobbies leading to some of Dubai’s most famous weekend brunches and postcard-perfect beaches. Le Méridien Mina Seyahi Beach Resort & Marina is one of the longest-standing hotels in Dubai Marina with 500 metres of private Arabian Gulf coastline providing a playground for water sports enthusiasts. Local expats regularly fill the resort’s Barasti bar, restaurant and beach club. A Dubai institution in its second decade, this well-liked venue has grown into a sprawling sports and beach bar with open-air screenings and food stalls, and the only free-entry beach club in town. Despite progression, Barasti retains its original theme, defined by palm fronds typically found in the traditional barasti shelters favoured by the early Bedouins. Other Dubai Marina beach clubs that draw crowds include Drift to Zero Gravity . Drift is dizzyingly beautiful; its pool deck, a catwalk for the latest swimwear fashions. Open until late, Zero Gravity is known for its high-octane parties and voyeuristic glass-sided pool. Sun worshippers on Dubai Marina’s deep sandy beaches pose for photos that frame its remarkable urban skyline. It’s a backdrop that’s hard to miss, containing some of the tallest residential towers in the world. The 101-storey Princess Tower once claimed the title of the highest, while the Cayan Tower retains its record for the world’s tallest building with a 90-degree twist; it’s structure akin to a giant corkscrew. Flying through the skyscrapers on XLine Dubai is an exhilarating way to experience this brave a

programme.title: Seoul
programme.desc: South Korea has been making waves on a global scale. Across Asia and the rest of the world, this capital city is a pulsating force in pop-culture and beauty. Like its denizens - well-dressed, confident, and proud - this influential city pushes the new frontiers while honoring its 2,000 year old heritage. Emerging as one of Asia’s tastemaker-cultures, Seoul births new trends in foods, fashion, beauty, technology, and entertainment. From 24hr shopping in Dongdaemun, hanging in HongDae, strolling down Garosugil, or drowning yourself in the different party scenes that define Itaewon and Gangnam’s nightlife, Seoul is trendy, vibrant, and engaging. While each neighborhood has its own distinction, Seoul pours out its love generously to all of its residents and visitors with each sip of soju or bite of kimchi. Whether you come for the food, the people, or the party, trust us, you’ll feel like you’re the underdog as the city test your limits. We love Seoul.

programme.title: Did you know Dubai is fifth most instagrammed city in the world?
programme.desc: Dubai has been named the 5th most Instagrammed city in the world in a survey by travel site Wego. From its sweeping beaches, to standout architecture and world class restaurants, there’s a photo opportunity to be found at every landmark and for every occasion. In fact, food is one of the main reasons for visiting the city. Dubai led the way in the food category for Instagram hashtags with a massive 26 per cent of all hashtags in or including Dubai also including food. This summer alone there were 79 million hashtags related to Dubai. Some of the hotspots include the city’s Miracle Garden which is the largest flower garden in the world. It has 72,000 square metres with over 50 million blooming flowers. As well as the Miracle Garden, downtown Dubai is also home to the Burj Khalifa which is also one of the top five most instagrammed places in the city. And in the city’s centrally located Zabeel Park you can find Dubai Frame, an architectural landmark. This 150-metre-high, 93-metre-wide structure is positioned so that visitors can soak in the views of modern Dubai to the south and old Dubai to the north. Mamoun Hmedan, Managing Director, MENA and India, Wego says the ranking is a huge achievement for Dubai. “Dubai is the one and only Arab city that’s ranked within the top five. That’s a lot for one city compared to very well-established tourism destinations,” he says. The top city in terms of hashtags was London with 118 million posts. Next was Paris with 101 million, followed by Nice and New York who received 87 million and 83 million respectively. Other top hashtags include Istanbul, Jakarta, Los Angeles, Barcelona, Moscow, and Tokyo. Sarah Hedley Hymers is a travel journalist and social media influencer. She says putting photos on Instagram is all about social capital. “You want to present something that is aspirational," she explains. "It has to be well-framed. It has to be colourful – dark pictures don’t do so well on Instagram. So, you’re looking for something that is bright, that real

programme.title: World's 6 most dangerous islands
programme.desc: Not all islands are about beaches, waves, and good times.

programme.title: Top Ten Things to do in Puerto Rico
programme.desc: Number 10: Go for a hike in El Yunque National park – This is the only subtropical rainforest in the US (besides Hawaii) and is filled with so much bio diversity. Make sure you spot the ylang ylang tree to smell the beautiful flowers used in some of the best perfumes. http://ecotourspuertorico.com/el-yunque-tours-rainforest/ Number 9: Have lunch in La Placita at Chef Jose Enrique’s restaurant. Jose Enrique is an award winning chef who uses his master culinary skills to enrich traditional Puerto Rican dishes. http://www.joseenriquepr.com/ Number 8: Shop in el Mercado in La Placita – Be sure to stop by and talk to Hector Ruiz Housler, who sells herbs and concoctions used to treat all sorts of ailments. Number 7: Have a cafecito at Café Cuatro Sombras - Located in Old San Juan and has the richest, most authentic Puerto Rican coffee in town. http://cuatrosombras.com/ Number 6: Visit Casa Cortés - Indulge your senses in fine chocolate and fine art here. Try their chocolate and cheese snack and sample one of their delicious chocolate beverages. http://www.casacortespr.com/ Number 5: Go to Piñones for authentic Puerto Rican street food – Try the fresh oysters, clams and all of the delicious fried food offered here. Be sure to pass by the cultural center to learn the history of this important Puerto Rican neighborhood. Number 4: Spend an afternoon in the Botanical Gardens – Take a tour and smell the cinnamon and bay rum trees and if you’re lucky, you just might spot a coqui. http://sanjuanpuertorico.com/san-juan-botanical-garden-jardin-botanico-universidad-de-puerto-rico/ Number 3: Stay on Condado Beach. I love the San Juan Marriott Resort and Casino. It’s a quick drive from the airport, has breathtaking views, and has amazing service. http://www.marriott.com/hotels/travel/sjupr-san-juan-marriott-resort-and-stellaris-casino/ Number 2: Have a Bioluminescence experience - Puerto Rico has three Bioluminescent bays which contain millions of micro-organisms, called “dinoflagellates”, that glow fluorescent in the dark when agi

programme.title: Women of Power Star Tennis Champ Venus Williams

Then, we highlight two past WPS Legacy Winners who changed the face of fashion and beauty: Barbara Smith and Bethann Hardison. programme.title: Cruel and Unusual

They were convicted by bribed witnesses and with no physical evidence. This film examines their struggle against an absolute miscarriage of justice.

programme.title: Residente

programme.title: Egyptian Pyramids: Architectural Wonder or Alien Engineering?
programme.desc: The Pyramids of Egypt are among the largest structures ever built. Archeologists and researchers have determined ancient Egypt lacked the tools and skills required to build the pyramids. So how did the Egyptians build them over four thousand years ago?

programme.title: Bigfoot: Living Creature or Legendary Lie?
programme.desc: Bigfoot. Sasquatch. Yeti. Yeren.Yowie. There are reports the world over of these terrifying creatures. This program shows a chilling eyewitness encounter plus scientific analysis of the creature’s footprints providing startling insights into this mystery.

programme.title: Horror Machine | The Myth of the Anunnaki
programme.desc: 450,000 years ago our ancestors descended from the heavens to engineer the first human beings. To us they were Giants that ruled as Gods over mankind. Now new evidence and scientific research acknowledges their existence on earth but reveals when they will return.

programme.title: Horror Machine | Archetype of the UFO by O.H. Krill
programme.desc: Investigators pose various questions about the possible origins of UFOs. Do they exist in reality or are they drawn from within the mind of man?

programme.title: Horror Machine | Crowbar: The Killings of Wendell Graves
programme.desc: After witnessing his parents' murder, Wendell returns to protect their home—with deadly force. A brutal slasher in the spirit of Psycho.

programme.title: The Island With Bear Grylls S01 E06 NB
programme.desc: Bear Grylls is abandoning 13 ordinary British men on a remote, uninhabited island in the pacific. Can they survive for a month completely alone? When stripped of all the luxuries and conveniences of 21st century living, does modern British man still have the spirit and skills to survive? The men are dropped off by Bear, and they are left totally alone with the clothes they stand up in and a few basic tools. In danger of being overwhelmed by the tides they battle through the dense undergrowth and the enormity of the task ahead quickly dawns on them.

programme.title: The RVers S01 E09 - International RVing, RV Etiquette NB
programme.desc: Peter and John explain the unique aspects of RVing from driving to electrical to sewage.

programme.title: Southern Uncovered with the Lee Brothers S01 E01 - Charleston, SC NB

programme.title: Southern Uncovered with the Lee Brothers S01 E02 - Atlanta, GA NB
programme.desc: Matt and Ted Lee discover the international flavors of Atlanta, from Southern meets Asian “Seoul” food to globally inspired ice pops and redefined airport dining.

programme.title: Paradise Kitchen Bali S01 E01 Jackfruit
programme.desc: In Bali's lush landscapes, Lauren explores the tropical origin of jackfruit, partnering with a Balinese chef to unveil age-old recipes and techniques, showcasing how this versatile fruit reigns supreme in traditional and modern dishes.

programme.title: Paradise Kitchen Bali S01 E02 Rice
programme.desc: Delve into the world of rice with Lauren as she explores different varieties, shares tricks, and puts her own twist on unique rice-based dishes, blending local and western recipes to create flavorful meals like Balinese Nasi Goreng and Risotto.

programme.title: My Pacific Quest S01 E01 - New Zealand & The Kermadec Islands NB
programme.desc: Ellis Emmett lives for adventure. Having conquered mountains and rivers in his homeland of New Zealand, his sights are now set on exploring the remote islands of the Pacific you can only get to by boat. The only trouble is, he doesn’t know how to sail. Ellis struggles with the physical and mental challenges of sailing but with help from friends both old and new, he finds his sea legs and sets off on his quest.

programme.title: NEW 10/9 - Belichick Drama at UNC, Longhorns on Life Support, Indiana Invades Oregon | Others Receiving Votes
programme.desc: On this week's episode, Sports Illustrated's Pat Forde and Bryan Fischer are joined by former longtime College Gameday reporter Gene Wojciechowski to talk about explosive developments in college football as several programs face unprecedented pressure points. Bill Belichick's North Carolina experiment appears headed toward catastrophic failure amid reports of total dysfunction within the program, forcing emergency statements from both the coach and athletic director. Meanwhile, the Red River Rivalry takes center stage as questions swirl around whether John Mateer will suit up for Oklahoma against a struggling Texas team led by Arch Manning, who continues facing harsh criticism despite limited playing time. The discussion expands to cover new NCAA rules allowing athletes to bet on professional sports, potentially opening dangerous precedents for college athletics. The experts also examine coaching carousel scenarios that could reshape major programs, from potential moves involving Lane Kiffin to Texas and James Franklin's possible departure from Penn State. The show concludes with game predictions for crucial matchups including Oregon versus Indiana and the high-stakes Red River showdown between the Oklahoma Sooners and Texas Longhorns.

programme.title: Preview for Autumn River

The exhilarating visuals are accompanied by a relaxing soundtrack in this 60 minute ambient nature film. The full length film is available to subscribers of NatureStream.tv.

programme.title: Journey Through the Lofoten Islands
